intro: Corispermum tibeticum f. integerrimum, commonly known as the Tibetan corispermum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Chenopodiaceae. It is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and produces clusters of tiny, greenish flowers. The plant is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, particularly in high-altitude environments of the Tibetan Plateau. It exhibits a compact growth habit and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. This subspecies is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
